title: People think the Nintendo Switch controller looks like a dog face - now we can't unsee it
text:

Nintendo released final details of its Switch game console during an event in Japan this morning, including the news that it will be available in shops from March 3 at a price of Â£279.99. 
The Switch is a hybrid console, meaning it can can be used at home in front of the TV, but can also transform into an on-the-go handheld gaming device with a 6.2-inch screen. 
But there's one thing that caught everyone's attention during the launch event, and it's to do with the shape of the new Joy-Con controller. Read More 
When in home console mode, and attached to the Joy-Con grip, the controller looks a lot like a droopy-eyed dog face: 
It even prompted some fan art: 
Some spotted a resemblance to Stitch, the "dog" in Disney's animated film Lilo & Stitch - prompting them to coin the phrase "Lilo and Switch": 
The Joy-Con can be used in multiple ways - independently in each hand, or together as one game controller when attached to the Joy-Con grip. 
They can also attach to the main console for use in handheld mode, or be shared with friends to enjoy two-player action in supported games. JoyCons for the Switch (Photo: Nintendo) 
As for games, the long-awaited The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild will be available at launch, alongside a party game called 1-2 Switch . 
Nintendo is also planning to bring back Mario later in the year, with the launch of Super Mario Odyssey , along with Mario Kart 8 Deluxe , Splatoon 2 and ARMS . 
Games from other developers include Fire Emblem Warriors , several Dragon Quest games, Xenoblade 2 , Shin Megami Tensei , Sonic Mania , Bomberman , Skyrim , Rayman , No More Heroes and FIFA . Read More
